page.title: 03BELAS KNAP - Pt.2
page.content:
The floors of the chambers were made of stone slates. The ceilings were made of flat capstones with the exception of the South East chamber which has a corbelled ceiling wh ere each stone slightly overlaps to form a dome. These mounds contain roughly enough stone to build a small Parish church.
There is a view of the Vale of Evesham from Belas Knap. It overlooks fields of barley and corn owned by a farmer from Charlton Abbots. In the area around the barrow there are 16 species of different plants.(2)
Belas Knap is just one of some 85 Neolithic tombs in the Cotswold-Severn area. (2)
